intro: Lithospermum viridiflorum, commonly known as greenflower lithosperm, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its square stems, opposite leaves, and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. Its roots contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Lithospermum viridiflorum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats.
